meanings.definition: Not able to be removed or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The love between a mother and her child is ineradicable.
meanings.sent2: The stain on the carpet was ineradicable despite many attempts to clean it.
meanings.sent3: The ineradicable marker doodle on the wall made the whole family laugh.
meanings.sent4: His ineradicable fear of spiders seemed to grow bigger each day.
meanings.sent5: The ineradicable memory of her first dance stayed with her forever.

meanings.sent1: The ineradicable weeds in the garden kept coming back no matter what.
meanings.sent2: The ineradicable virus spread quickly throughout the population.
meanings.sent3: The ineradicable rumor about the principal being a secret superhero amused the students.
meanings.sent4: His ineradicable optimism shone brightly even in the darkest times.
meanings.sent5: The ineradicable bond between the twins was truly unbreakable.
